description: Get an insider’s look at RISD, from the latest academic concentrations available to students to the typical studio critique. Faculty and staff lead a series of informative sessions (=see below=). Class sizes are limited and available on a first come, first served basis.
name: RISD Revealed

description: Get the weekend off to a great start as President Rosanne Somerson 76 ID, the first alumna to lead the college, talks about her vision for RISD.
name: President’s Welcome Reception

description:
Environmental performance has become a fundamental principle of urban design. But how do we know how well green designs and practices perform over time? Research shows that in many cases there is a gap between intended and actual performance. Architect and educator Liat Margolis 96 ID shares new empirical research developed at the University of Toronto’s Green Roof Innovation Testing Laboratory (GRIT Lab) that bridges this gap.

Liat Margolis is associate professor and program director of the Masters of Landscape Architecture program at the University of Toronto and John H. Daniels Associate Professor of Architecture, Landscape and Design. She also directs the University of Toronto’s GRIT Lab, an interdisciplinary research facility dedicated to evaluating and optimizing the environmental performance of green building technologies. Her 2014 book =Out of Water: Design Solutions for Arid Regions= discusses strategies for sustainable and resilient urban water management.
name: Alumni Keynote | Liat Margolis 96 ID
subtitle: Data-Driven Landscapes: Research into Green Roof Performance

description: Ready to party? Stop by The Wurks Artist Collaborative, a shared workspace located in Providence’s historic mill district founded by RISD alumni Will Reeves 08 SC and Colin Bliss 10 SC. Enjoy a RISD-style dance party and spend some quality time catching up with classmates. Cash bar, snacks provided, alumni of all ages welcome.
name: Late Night at The Wurks Artist Collaborative
